column4: oCean, hard = hard to configure...both ends are server and client
it should not - but sometimes... (sorry for the obvious answer) For ftp port 21 should be open and NAT'ed
please be serious. This is not social channel nor chat
I'm not here to be social, i'm here to get help...but if nobody's here to help you've got to do something to "be patient"
I understand, and your help is appreciated. It's just that not every user coming here would know that you are joking.
what was your question?
I'm trying to set up FTP file shares between myself and a buddy
via Filezilla and it's not working. it's complaining about "mismatched ports" although all ports are open and forwarded to my internal IP
ok. FTP server is setup?
do you have to run a server as a service? or does that come with Filezilla
that was my first question
You have to setup a seperate FTP service / daemon
ok, so you have to have it running. That's what I was thinking. What's the package you have to download?
filezilla is only the client.
I like the proftpd, but they all have their own tweaks
why did I not come across those with Google? I did see something about vsftpd but it was in Ubuntu docs but for 6.06
is it hard if you're behind NAT?
yeah, I've already got port 21 forwarded to my internal IP
installing proftpd now
let me find a link for setup
ubuntugeek tutorials are nice: http://www.ubuntugeek.com/settingup-an-ftp-server-on-ubuntu-with-proftpd.html
run "sudo netstat -anp | grep 21" and look in the upper few lines or do "sudo netstat -anp |grep ftp" Also, you could try to "ftp localhost"
